PM2.5 is made up of different chemicals, including black carbon and organic matter, and is often caused by car traffic and fossil fuel combustion.

The study found that an increase in PM2.5 was linked to a 6-7% increase in #dementia and a 9% increase in #Alzheimer's disease.

Did you know that breathing in polluted air can increase your risk of getting dementia?

A new study found that long-term exposure to fine particulate matter (PM2.5) can increase your chances of getting all-cause dementia and Alzheimer's disease. https://t.co/Tr7axJDg9K
